This is really inconvenient for use in the Nursery.Upon further research I found other technicians saying that the soldering job on the AC adapter on the board was really poor quality and gave reason to why there were several faults. So its up to the individual. Goodluck!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: New Dad
Reviews.Content: This monitor worked perfectly and we tried a different brand first but had to return it since the range was not very good.  I highly recommend this Lorex monitor.  The picture is crystal clear and the sound is great too.  We searched for a long time before finding this awesome product.

Reviews.Title: NEW BABY DADDY
Reviews.Author: HEMMINGWAY "CIGARSMOKER"
Reviews.Content: GREAT PICTURE AND SOUNDCAMERA SENSITIVITY SENSITIVE TO ADJUSTMENT NEEDS TWO PERSONS TO SET UP

Reviews.Title: This is the second video monitor that I've owned
Reviews.Author: CLC
Reviews.Content: I own a 2 year old 2.4ghz from Sharper image.  I really like this one, but now have 2 children to monitor.  The Lorex interfers the signal of my Sharper Image, so I can not use them both as I had hoped to.  I do not believe that I will be able to use any other system (this is my 3rd try) so I'll likely be buying the second camera for the Lorex.My phones are dect 6.0.For the same distance, my Sharper Image monitor is more real time where the Lorex sometimes shows frame by frame movement even within a 10 foot range.  I have not tested the range limit yet.The monitor screen on the Lorex is very good.  Its large screen is a bonus and I really like the rechargeable base station.  Don't expect vibrant colors like your TV.  I haven't seen this out of any system that I've tried yet.The negative is as other's have mentioned, I would prefer to have constant sound.  My 2 year old often plays quietly on the floor of her room where she is not within the monitor's view.  I can't tell if she's napping under the covers or playing quietly on the floor unless she starts singing or I open the door and blow my 'free' time..which isn't going to happen!Overall, I believe this to be the best camera on the market.  I expect them to improve drastically over the next few years, wish I could wait. :)

Reviews.Title: Keep Your $$$, Find Something More Functional
Reviews.Author: A. Schacher "Practical Mom"
Reviews.Content: When first searching for the perfect video monitor for our children's bedrooms and our playroom I made sure to research EVERY possible "baby monitor" out there. My husband suggested looking into security camera's and I sort of chringed at the idea. HOWEVER, I wish that I would have researched that idea. With all the technology that is out there today. I would have definintely purchased something that I could view on my mobile phone. Now, on to the actual Lorex monitor.%1: I dealt with customer service only once by email and was VERY dissapointed. I sent them the issue that I had just to get some feedback and without questioning when I purchased or the model number of my monitor they replied with "your item is out of warranty". I then sent back to them the model and date of purchase and they told me that I would have to send back the original base (I'll explain the problem in a minute) and wait for them to send me a new one. Anyone that has a monitor of any kind with kids knows that it is pretty nessecariy with children (esspecially if you want to go outside while a little one is taking a nap) and it would be a HUGE inconvinience to send back a peice that I need in order for the system to function.#2: The monitor itself doesn't deal with normal wear and tear very well. I have had my iphone for almost 3 years. I take it with me everywhere, my children play with it, and I have dropped it numerous times. It still works like a champ. This monitor has been upstairs and downstairs in our home, dropped only a few times mostly on carpet (I feel like that is "normal wear and tear") and is not doing good. I feel like it is only a matter of one more accidental drop before it quits working. So, needless to say, it isn't very sturdy for the normal wear and tear of "mom-life".#3: The charging base has prongs that have to be matched up with the bottom of the monitor. These prongs easily get bend down (just by putting the monitor on the base) and cause the monitor not to charge. So, you could go throughout the night and if it is bumped even a little bit, the monitor will stop charging and die without you even knowing it. Seems like it was made pretty cheap.#4: Doesn't pick up the cameras at random times (not even when I am "out of range"). It sometimes doesn't pick up the camera that is a room over from our bedroom. Strange. Speaking of range...it's not that great!Way overpriced for what you get. I would expect to pay much less for this product. Don't buy this one, find one that is updated.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: L. Kent
Reviews.Content: We purchased this item six months ago but only started using it on the 16th of September.. right the day that I came back home from the hospital.. my baby is now 3 months and a half and the monitor reception is not working any more.... I actually would like to know if it is possible to send it back and get a new one, a repared one or a refund...Regards,

Reviews.Title: Depends on the need
Reviews.Author: Big Spender
Reviews.Content: This was our second monitor we bought.  It has since been returned.  What we did not like about it:1. LCD only stays on for a few seconds and then power saves off.2. Audio is not a continuous speaker, it only kicks on if it "hears" a sound.We have a newborn and based on these reviews, we thought it would be perfect.  My wife H A T E D this so back it went.  It wasn't that great for a baby monitor, in our opinion.
